intro: Pteroceras muriculatum, commonly known as the rough-stemmed liverwort, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is a non-vascular plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. The plant has a thalloid structure with a leafy, branched stem covered in small, scale-like leaves. Its reproductive structures, known as gametophytes, are found on the upper surface of the stems. Pteroceras muriculatum is characterized by its rough, textured appearance and is often found in temperate regions.
